communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I would like any records of any "Bulletin Board Systems" or "BBSs" that were operated by the US Secret Service between the years of 1984 and 1999. These Bulletin Board systems were built for the purpose of sting operations against online fraud.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emily Crose

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Fr. Albert Sidney Foley (NARA)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

FBI Files on Father Albert Sidney Foley, the Jesuit priest, professor at Spring Hill College in Mobile, Alabama and anti-KKK activist (https://uscatholic.org/articles/201311/father-albert-foley-how-one-priest-took-on-the-kkk/). A previous request to the FBI indicated potentially responsive records were moved to NARA, and indicated I should use "44-HQ-16371" as a reference number. 

I am making this request in my capacity as a journalist who has written extensively about government transparency, including several books on the FBI specifically. As such, I am not requesting a fee waiver, but I am requesting I be placed in the media requester category.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JPat Brown

communications.subject: Fwd: Freedom of Information Act Request: Fr. Albert Sidney Foley (NARA)
communications.communication:
Dear JPat Brown:

Thank you for submitting your Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to
the National Archives and Records Administration (NARA) via email to
FOIA@nara.gov.  Your request concerns FBI file 44-HQ-16371.

Our office handles FOIA and Privacy Act requests for the NARA's
operational records
(records created by this agency).  Since your request is for archival
records (records created by or originated in a different agency, but that
may have been transferred to the legal custody of NARA) to which access may
be restricted, we are forwarding it by this email to our Office of Research
Services, Special Access and FOIA staff who handle FOIA requests for such
archival records.

That office will assign your request a tracking number, and respond
directly to you.  In the future, if you need to follow up with that office,
please contact them at the address below, or electronically via email
(email is preferred).

The National Archives and Records Administration
Special Access and FOIA Staff (RF)
8601 Adelphi Road, Room 5500
College Park, MD 20740

Phone: 301-837-3190
Fax: 301-837-1864
Email: specialaccess_foia@nara.gov

For your reference, a copy of your request is below.

Please visit our website at www.archives.gov/foia  for further information
about making a FOIA request to NARA.  On our main website, www.archives.gov,
you can learn more about the resources that we offer to the public, and you
can access our online catalog.

Due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and pursuant to guidance received from the
Office of Management and Budget (OMB), NARA had adjusted its normal
operations to balance the need of completing its mission-critical work
while also adhering to the recommended social distancing for the safety of
our staff. As a result of this re-prioritization of activities, you may
experience a delay in receiving a substantive response to your FOIA
request.  We apologize for this inconvenience and appreciate your
understanding and patience.

Sincerely,
Ashley Bryan
Government Information Specialist
Office of General Counsel (NGC)
National Archives and Records Administration
8601 Adelphi Road
College Park, Maryland, 20740-6001
301-837-3642

title: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (July 2021-July 2023) regarding "crime free" housing and nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as “program” and "ordinance" respectively, in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as “Crime Free Multi-Housing Program” and "Minimum Standards for Multifamily Dwelling Complexes" as described in Fort Worth's Code of Ordinances Sec. 7-410.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program and Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance or program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the program and ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Crime Free Housing and Nuisance Ordinance Information Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records from the past two years (July 2021-July 2023) regarding "Citywide Nuisance Abatement Program (CNAP)" and nuisance property ordinances that will be referred to as “program” and "ordinance" respectively, in this request but could be known (but not limited to) as “CNAP” and "Narcotics, Violent Crime, Unlawful Weapon or Ammunition Crime, and Gang-Related Crime Eviction Program" as described in the Los Angeles Code of Ordinances Sec. 47.50.

Please provide any and all written records (including but not limited to hard-copy documents, memos, emails, word processor documents, PDF documents, PowerPoint files, images files, video files etc.) regarding the Program and Ordinance including but not limited to:

• any training/presentation materials used in communication, promotions, workshops, seminars, etc

• criminal background checks performed on prospective tenants

• evictions filed by property owners and number of tenants evicted as a result of the program and ordinance

• suspensions or revocation of a residential rental license, against property owners who fail to comply with the requirements of the ordinance or program

• police calls, reports, citations, or arrests, collected by the municipality police department for the purpose of enforcing the ordinance and program

• meeting minutes and correspondence between municipality officials, regarding the implementation and enforcement of the program and ordinance

• all documents concerning the passage of the nuisance ordinance and any amendments to it, including communications with City elected officials, city staff, and others, and any data relied upon or reviewed as a part of the passage or amendments to the nuisance ordinance since July 2021 to present.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jenny Wadhwa

The Department of Administrative and Financial Services (DAFS ) acknowledges your request, while simultaneously reserving the right to withhold, in part or in full, documents that are protected from disclosure by rule or statute. title: Rockland County DA office emails to or from Google regarding my gmail account

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Rockland County DA office emails to or from Google regarding my gmail account
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any emails to or from a Rockland County District Attorney's email address to uslawenforcement@google.com regarding case number: RCDA-21-00340 and my personal email address of RobbyDelaware1979@gmail.com. 

Hello. I recently received an email from Google's Legal Investigations Support Division that said in part: "Google received and responded to legal process issued by the Rockland County District Attorney's Office compelling the release of information related to your Google account. A court order previously prohibited Google from notifying you of the legal process. We are now permitted to disclose the receipt of the legal process to you. The agency reference number or case number on the legal process is RCDA-21-00340."

This email would have been from a missing person case I did private research into. I was more than a little surprised to learn that Rockland County used subpoena powers to compel Google to pass over information about my account. Considering that Google provided information about the request from Rockland County, then there is no longer an active investigation and the emails are a public record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Delaware

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear Sir/Ms,

I am a Norwegian journalist and author, requesting information under the US Freedom of Information Act. I understand that the documents I hereby request has been classified in the past. However, given the long time which has passed, it is my belief that these documents can now be released and read by the public.

The documents I seek are two agreements between the United States of America and Norway:
- U.S. Communications Intelligence agreement signed on 10 December 1954, and 
- a follow-up agreement the with the same two parties signed on 1 August 1979.

The two agreements are often referred to as the «NORUSA Pact».
I request the main agreement as well as the attached documents which follows these agreements. 


Kind regards,

Tarjei Leer-Salvesen
Solbergveien 3, 4615 Kristiansand, Norway

I am seeking all source data, both provisional and final, used in calculating the 2021 birth data as provided in response to FOIL request #23-03-192. This includes, but is not limited to:

	1.	Raw data sets, databases, or spreadsheets used as the basis for the 2021 birth data calculations.
	2.	Statistical methodologies, algorithms, or software tools used in processing and analyzing the 2021 birth data.
	3.	Any draft versions, preliminary calculations, or interim reports related to the 2021 birth data.
	4.	Communications or memos discussing challenges, discrepancies, or issues related to the collection, processing, or validation of the 2021 birth data.
	5.	Any records or communications that discuss reasons for the unavailability or delay in releasing birth data after 2019.

I understand that the New York State Department of Health has a legal obligation to respond to my request within 20 business days, as required by the FOIL law. If the department anticipates that it will be unable to provide the requested information within that time frame, I ask that you notify me in writing and provide an explanation for the delay, as well as a new estimated timeline for providing the responsive records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Boston Fire Dept. Suspension Letter
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

There is a known email dated 1/20/23 sent at 4:24 pm EST from Boston Fire Commissioner Paul Burke to Deputy Chief of Staff Yusufi Vali, with the subject titled "Strong", with the body of the text referring to a disciplinary action taken against Boston Firefighter Anthony Wayne Strong. This email also contains a pdf attachment labeled "FF Anthony Strong Suspension.pdf".

I am seeking access to that attached letter which fully explains the disciplinary action against Anthony Strong.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chip Goines

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Henry Park
communications.communication:
Dear FBI:

This is a request for records under the Freedom of Information Act.

RECORDS REQUESTED

All records related to Henry C. Park. Mr. Park was a leftist academic. He was involved in the founding of RADACADS (short for "RADical ACADemics") at Harvard University and in the Maoist International Movement. He co-edited the opinion page of the Michigan Daily while earning his doctorate at the University of Michigan. He sometimes used the pseudonyms “MC3” or “MIM3”. He was born in October 1962, although I am not sure of the date or place of his birth. He died on 17 May 2011. At the time of his death, he lived in Somerville, Massachusetts. He had previously lived in Hopewell Junction, New York. Proof of Mr. Park's death is attached.

CROSS-REFERENCE SEARCH

Please conduct a cross-reference search of your files on the following people and organizations to see if they contain additional records related to Mr. Gray:

(1) RADACADS (the "RADical ACADemics" group at Harvard)
(2) Maoist International Movement

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Francis “Cadillac Frank” Salemme
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The FBI file on Francis “Cadillac Frank” Salemme, who died in prison in late 2022: https://turnto10.com/news/local/ex-mafia-boss-cadillac-frank-salemme-dies-in-prison-at-89-december-18-2022

Please note that I am a reporter for The Boston Globe.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alexa Gagosz

title: Washington DSHS Youth Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Washington DSHS Youth Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of fees and debt for incarcerated youth (i.e., juvenile):

All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which incarcerated youth (i.e. juvenile) and/or their parents or legal guardians are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department/office or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of youths (i.e., juveniles) charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kelly Stevenson

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

There is a known email dated 1/20/23 from Fire Commissioner Paul Burke to Yusufi Vali, with the subject titled "Strong",  with the body of the text referring to a disciplinary action taken against Boston Firefighter Anthony Wayne Strong.  This email also contains a pdf attachment labeled "FF Anthony Strong Suspension.pdf".

I am seeking access to that attached letter which fully explains the disciplinary action against Anthony Strong.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Chip Goines

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: VCCP Patient Safety Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All complaints, reports, and patient safety data -- including Serious Reportable Events, Hospital Acquired Conditions as reported to the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services, and Agency for Healthcare Research and Quality Patient Safety Indicators -- for provider associated with the VA's Veteran Community Care Program (VCCP).

Much of this data is collected through the department's third party administrators, including TriWest and Optum. Please also provide the Clinical Quality Monitoring Plans implemented by the TPAs, which are required to include quality monitoring activities for patient safety, clinical quality assurance, clinical quality improvement, and peer review. Finally please provide all information, mandated under federal contracts, that TPAs collect in their efforts to identify, track, trend, and report interventions to resolve any potential or identified quality issues. 

The creation and collection of this information is detailed in recent Congressional testimony here:

https://docs.house.gov/meetings/VR/VR03/20220714/114988/HHRG-117-VR03-Wstate-LaPuzM-20220714-U1.pdf

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jasper Craven

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Fall River Air Raid Sirens
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents pertaining to the make, model, and installation location of each of the air raid sirens owned and operated by the City of Fall River during the Cold War, and eventually removed from operation by the 2000s. Information in regards to the former testing times and usage circumstances would be much appreciated as well.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

title: Records Related to White Supremacy and Militia Groups NYSP

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Records Related to White Supremacy and Militia Groups NYSP
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: August 7, 2023

New York State Police
1220 Washington Avenue
Building 22
Albany, NY 12226-2252

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – Records Related to White Supremacy and Militia Groups

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the New York State Police pertaining to white supremacy groups and militia organizations, including but not limited to NSC-131, Proud Boys, Patriot Front, Atomwaffen Division, Identity Evropa (also known as the American Identity Movement), the Base, Bowl Patrol, Boogaloo Movement, New York Light Foot Militia, New York Militia TM, New York Mutual Assistance Group, and any other similar groups not specifically listed, from January 1, 2020, through the current time this request is processed. I request that these records be provided in a machine-readable format, such as an Excel spreadsheet or CSV file, wherever possible.

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

1. Incident reports involving these groups.
2. Investigation files pertaining to these groups.
3. Any intelligence briefings, memos, or other internal communications related to these groups.
4. Any lists, databases, or compilations that maintain records of these groups and their activities.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: +1 845-218-0299

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

title: List of Individuals Banned from the State House in Trenton, NJ

communications.subject: New Jersey Open Public Records Act Request: List of Individuals Banned from the State House in Trenton, NJ
communications.communication:
MuckRock News
DEPT MR 146407
263 Huntington Ave
Boston, MA 02115

Date: August 7, 2023

New Jersey State Police
P.O. Box 7068
West Trenton, NJ 08628-0068

Attn: FOIA Officer

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – List of Individuals Banned from the State House in Trenton, NJ

Dear FOIA Officer,

Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the New Jersey State Police pertaining to individuals who have been banned from the State House in Trenton, NJ from January 1, 2020, through the current time this request is processed. I request that these records be provided in a machine-readable format, such as an Excel spreadsheet or CSV file, wherever possible.

For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:

1. Official notices of banishment or barring orders.
2. Internal documentation or correspondences related to these individuals and their prohibited status.
3. Any lists, databases, or compilations that maintain records of these individuals.

Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).

Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).

Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.

If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.

As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Sincerely,
Jordan Lassiter
Independent Investigative Journalist
TransparencyReport.pw
Email: Jordan@Lassiter.eu
Phone: +1 845-218-0299

Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request Letter

Please be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. Additionally, any correspondence in relation to this request will be instantly published on the platform.

 Description  
 MuckRock NewsDEPT MR 146407263 Huntington AveBoston, MA 02115Date: August 7, 2023New York State Police1220 Washington AvenueAlbany, NY 12226-2252Attn: FOIA OfficerSubject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request – List of Individuals Banned from the Capital Building in Albany, NYDear FOIA Officer,Under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act, 5 U.S.C. § 552, I hereby request access to and copies of all records held by the New York State Police pertaining to individuals who have been banned from the Capital Building in Albany, NY from January 1, 2020, through the current time this request is processed. I request that these records be provided in a machine-readable format, such as an Excel spreadsheet or CSV file, wherever possible.For the purpose of this request, the records I seek include, but are not limited to:1. Official notices of banishment or barring orders.2. Internal documentation or correspondences related to these individuals and their prohibited status.3. Any lists, databases, or compilations that maintain records of these individuals.Should any portion of the requested records be deemed exempt from disclosure, I request the release of any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions in accordance with 5 U.S.C. § 552(b). If an entire document is exempt, I request a justification, citing specific FOIA exemptions, and provision of an exemption log as per Vaughn v. Rosen, 484 F.2d 820 (D.C. Cir. 1973).Please note your obligation under the law not to destroy any records potentially responsive to this request. Any withholding, redaction, or destruction of responsive records without proper justification constitutes a violation of the FOIA and is subject to litigation, as confirmed in Kissinger v. Reporters Committee for Freedom of the Press, 445 U.S. 136, 150 (1980).Enclosed is a letter requesting a fee waiver for the processing of this request. As an independent investigative journalist associated with TransparencyReport.pw, I believe that the information I seek is in the public interest and its disclosure contributes significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government.If the enclosed waiver is not accepted and there are any potential charges in excess of $200 associated with fulfilling my request, please inform me in advance.As stipulated by the FOIA, I look forward to your response within twenty business days (5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(A)(i)).Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.Sincerely,Jordan LassiterIndependent Investigative JournalistTransparencyReport.pwEmail: Jordan@Lassiter.euPhone: +1 845-218-0299Enclosure: Fee Waiver Request LetterPlease be aware: All communications related to this request, including incoming and outgoing communications, will be publicly available on MuckRock.com. communications.subject: NYSP FOIL REQUEST
communications.communication:
August 9, 2023

Jordan Lassiter
MuckRock News, DEPT MR150442
263 Huntington Avenue
Boston, Massachusetts 02115
Re: FOIL Number NYSP-23-08-863
Dear Jordan Lassiter:
This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by New York State Police on August 8, 2023. The request was for "List of Individuals Banned from the Capital Building in Albany, NY".
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached by or before October 12, 2023.
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.
PLEASE NOTE: **
As we have acknowledged your request, please refrain from submitting duplicate requests for the same records through Open FOIL.  Submitting a duplicate request takes time away from processing the hundreds of requests received each month.  If you have additional information to add to your request, or you would like to know the status of your request, please contact the FOIL Unit via email or call us at (518) 464-7100, option #2.


Sincerely,
[cid:image001.jpg@01D9CA89.304922D0]
Staff Inspector William H. Gorman
Records Access Officer
Central Records Bureau


________________________________

If you received this e-mail in error or from someone who was not authorized to send it to you, do not disseminate, copy or otherwise use this e-mail or its attachments. Please notify the sender immediately by reply e-mail and delete the e-mail from your system.
